StructOpt

StructOpt is a general optimizer for python targeted at identifying stable atomic structures.StructOpt was designed to provide both flexibility and simplicity. While there are many optional parameters to allow the user great customizability, there are also many default settings that allow for faster more simple runs. The Quick Start section of this document provides details on the basic information required to perform an optimization. Additional details on input and output structures can be found in the Input and Output Syntax section of this document. Details on the many options currently available for StructOpt are provided in the Functionalities section of this document. A list of these options is also provided in the Reference Listing section of this document. The Case Studies section provides some example problems and serves as a general tutorial. Useful tips for expanding StructOpt with additional user subroutines or options can be found in the User Expansion section of this document. Finally, an explanation of commonly generated errors and troubleshooting advice is provided in the section entitled Error Messages.
